subject: Football
College Athletics
lead_paragraph: Quarterback Armanti Edwards rushed for 313 yards and 4 touchdowns and threw for 182 yards and 3 more scores to help Appalachian State advance to the Football Championship Subdivision title game with a 55-35 victory over Richmond last night in Boone, N.C.Edwards dominated on the ground as the Mountaineers built a 21-point lead. After Richmond (12-3) rallied to tie the score, Edwards threw two passes for touchdowns in the final 10 minutes. His yards rushing were the most by a quarterback in the F.C.S. — formerly Division I-AA. Appalachian State (12-2) will play the winner of today’s Delaware-Southern Illinois game next Friday in Chattanooga, Tenn.
